meanings.definition: A downward stroke made in writing or drawing.
meanings.sent1: She practiced her downstrokes in calligraphy class.
meanings.sent2: His artwork improved after he focused on perfecting his downstrokes.
meanings.sent3: The downstrokes of her pen danced gracefully on the paper.
meanings.sent4: The downstrokes of the artist's brush brought life to the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The teacher emphasized the importance of smooth downstrokes in drawing.

meanings.definition: The act of striking a musical instrument in a downward direction.
meanings.sent1: The musician's downstrokes on the guitar created a rhythmic melody.
meanings.sent2: He practiced his downstrokes on the drums to keep the beat steady.
meanings.sent3: The downstrokes of the pianist added depth to the music.
meanings.sent4: Her downstrokes on the violin resonated throughout the concert hall.
meanings.sent5: The band's energy was fueled by the powerful downstrokes of the guitarist.

meanings.definition: A downward movement or stroke, as in swimming or fencing.
meanings.sent1: His strong downstrokes in swimming propelled him forward in the race.
meanings.sent2: The fencer's precise downstrokes helped him win the match.
meanings.sent3: The synchronized swimmers coordinated their downstrokes beautifully.
meanings.sent4: The downstrokes of the swimmer cut through the water like a knife.
meanings.sent5: The fencer's swift downstrokes caught his opponent off guard.
